test_cases.Title: Verify SGP Generator Full Responsiveness on Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Open the SGP Generator application in a desktop web browser (e.g., Chrome, Firefox, Edge).
Steps.Expected Result: SGP Generator loads successfully without layout issues.

Steps.Step Description: Resize the browser window to various widths (e.g., 1920px, 1366px, 1024px, 800px).
Steps.Expected Result: SGP Generator layout adapts smoothly to each width, maintaining usability and readability.

Steps.Step Description: Interact with all main features (e.g., add selections, remove selections, generate SGP) at each width.
Steps.Expected Result: All features remain accessible and functional at all tested widths.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has access to a desktop computer with a modern web browser.
2. SGP Generator application is deployed and accessible.
test_cases.Dataset: No specific data required; use default SGP Generator interface.
test_cases.Expected Result: SGP Generator is fully usable and visually correct at all common desktop resolutions.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only desktop browser responsiveness.

test_cases.Title: Verify SGP Generator Full Responsiveness on Mobile Devices

Steps.Step Description: Open the SGP Generator application on a mobile device (e.g., iPhone, Android phone) using a mobile browser.
Steps.Expected Result: SGP Generator loads successfully without layout issues.

Steps.Step Description: Rotate the device between portrait and landscape orientations.
Steps.Expected Result: SGP Generator layout adapts smoothly to both orientations, maintaining usability and readability.

Steps.Step Description: Interact with all main features (e.g., add selections, remove selections, generate SGP) in both orientations.
Steps.Expected Result: All features remain accessible and functional in both orientations.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has access to a modern smartphone with a supported mobile browser.
2. SGP Generator application is deployed and accessible.
test_cases.Dataset: No specific data required; use default SGP Generator interface.
test_cases.Expected Result: SGP Generator is fully usable and visually correct in both portrait and landscape modes on mobile devices.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only mobile browser responsiveness.

test_cases.Title: Verify SGP Generator Full Responsiveness on Tablet Devices

Steps.Expected Result: SGP Generator loads successfully without layout issues.

Steps.Step Description: Rotate the device between portrait and landscape orientations.
Steps.Expected Result: SGP Generator layout adapts smoothly to both orientations, maintaining usability and readability.

Steps.Step Description: Interact with all main features (e.g., add selections, remove selections, generate SGP) in both orientations.

test_cases.Preconditions:

test_cases.Dataset: No specific data required; use default SGP Generator interface.
test_cases.Expected Result: SGP Generator is fully usable and visually correct in both portrait and landscape modes on tablet devices.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only tablet browser responsiveness.

test_cases.Title: Verify SGP Generator Layout and Functionality on Edge Case Resolutions

Steps.Step Description: Open the SGP Generator application in a browser or emulator set to an uncommon screen resolution (e.g., 320x480, 2560x1440).
Steps.Expected Result: SGP Generator loads successfully without layout issues.

Steps.Step Description: Interact with all main features (e.g., add selections, remove selections, generate SGP) at each tested resolution.
Steps.Expected Result: All features remain accessible and functional at all tested resolutions.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has access to device or emulator capable of setting custom resolutions.
2. SGP Generator application is deployed and accessible.
test_cases.Dataset: No specific data required; use default SGP Generator interface.
test_cases.Expected Result: SGP Generator is fully usable and visually correct at edge case resolutions.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers edge case resolutions for responsiveness.

test_cases.Title: Verify SGP Generator Accessibility of All Features Across Devices

Steps.Step Description: Open the SGP Generator application on desktop, mobile, and tablet devices.
Steps.Expected Result: SGP Generator loads successfully on all devices.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access and use all main features (e.g., add selections, remove selections, generate SGP) on each device type.
Steps.Expected Result: All features are accessible and functional on all device types.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has access to desktop, mobile, and tablet devices with supported browsers.
2. SGP Generator application is deployed and accessible.
test_cases.Dataset: No specific data required; use default SGP Generator interface.
test_cases.Expected Result: All SGP Generator features are accessible and functional on all supported device types.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers feature accessibility across device types.

test_cases.Title: Verify Carousel Display Conditions on Home Page

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Home Page of the application.
Steps.Expected Result: The Home Page loads successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the carousel section on the Home Page.
Steps.Expected Result: The carousel is displayed only if the display conditions are met (e.g., there are available cards to show).

Steps.Step Description: Check the scenario where no cards are available for the carousel.
Steps.Expected Result: The carousel section is not displayed on the Home Page.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1. User is not logged in (for anonymous scenario). 2. Application is running in a supported environment. 3. Home Page content is available.
test_cases.Dataset: N/A
test_cases.Expected Result: The carousel is displayed only when the display conditions are satisfied; otherwise, it is hidden.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only display conditions, not card structure or caching.

test_cases.Title: Verify Structure of a Single Precompiled Card in Home Page Carousel

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Home Page with carousel enabled and at least one precompiled card available.
Steps.Expected Result: The carousel is visible with at least one card.

Steps.Step Description: Inspect the structure of the first card in the carousel.
Steps.Expected Result: The card displays all required elements (e.g., image, title, description, call-to-action button) as per design specifications.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1. At least one precompiled card is configured and available for display. 2. Application is running in a supported environment.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample precompiled card data (image, title, description, CTA).
test_cases.Expected Result: Each card in the carousel adheres to the specified structure and displays all required elements.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Focuses on card structure, not carousel behavior or caching.

test_cases.Title: Verify Caching of Precompiled Cards in Home Page Carousel

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Home Page with carousel enabled and precompiled cards available.
Steps.Expected Result: The carousel and its cards are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Reload the Home Page without clearing the cache.
Steps.Expected Result: The carousel loads quickly, and the same precompiled cards are displayed from cache.

Steps.Step Description: Clear the application/browser cache and reload the Home Page.
Steps.Expected Result: The carousel fetches fresh precompiled cards from the server and displays them.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1. Precompiled cards are available for the carousel. 2. Application supports caching mechanism. 3. User has access to clear cache (browser or app).
test_cases.Dataset: Precompiled card data; cache enabled/disabled scenarios.
test_cases.Expected Result: Precompiled cards are cached and loaded quickly unless the cache is cleared, in which case fresh data is fetched.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers caching only for Home Page carousel, not for event detail.

test_cases.Title: Verify Skeleton Loader Display on Home Page During Carousel Data Fetch

Steps.Step Description: Simulate slow network conditions or delay the carousel data response.
Steps.Expected Result: The Home Page loads, but carousel data is not immediately available.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the carousel section while data is loading.
Steps.Expected Result: A skeleton loader (placeholder UI) is displayed in the carousel area until the data is fully loaded.

Steps.Step Description: Wait for the carousel data to finish loading.
Steps.Expected Result: The skeleton loader is replaced by the actual carousel cards once data is available.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1. Application supports skeleton loader for carousel. 2. Network throttling or delay can be simulated.
test_cases.Dataset: N/A (simulate slow network or delayed API response).
test_cases.Expected Result: Skeleton loader is shown during data fetch and replaced by carousel cards upon data availability.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only skeleton loader behavior, not carousel content.

test_cases.Title: Verify Carousel Display Conditions in Event Detail (Bet Builder Tab)

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Event Detail page and select the Bet Builder tab.
Steps.Expected Result: The Bet Builder tab loads successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the carousel section within the Bet Builder tab.
Steps.Expected Result: The carousel is displayed only if the display conditions are met (e.g., relevant cards are available for the event).

Steps.Step Description: Check the scenario where no cards are available for the event.
Steps.Expected Result: The carousel section is not displayed in the Bet Builder tab.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1. Event Detail page is accessible. 2. Bet Builder tab is enabled for the event. 3. Relevant cards are configured for the event.
test_cases.Dataset: Event with and without relevant carousel cards.
test_cases.Expected Result: The carousel is displayed in the Bet Builder tab only when display conditions are satisfied; otherwise, it is hidden.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only display conditions for event detail carousel.

test_cases.Title: Verify Structure of a Precompiled Card in Event Detail Carousel (Bet Builder Tab)

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Event Detail page with carousel enabled in the Bet Builder tab and at least one precompiled card available.
Steps.Expected Result: The carousel is visible with at least one card in the Bet Builder tab.

Steps.Step Description: Inspect the structure of the first card in the carousel within the Bet Builder tab.
Steps.Expected Result: The card displays all required elements (e.g., image, title, description, call-to-action button) as per design specifications.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1. At least one precompiled card is configured for the event. 2. Bet Builder tab is enabled. 3. Application is running in a supported environment.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample precompiled card data for event (image, title, description, CTA).
test_cases.Expected Result: Each card in the event detail carousel adheres to the specified structure and displays all required elements.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Focuses on card structure in event detail, not carousel behavior or caching.

test_cases.Title: Verify Caching of Precompiled Cards in Event Detail Carousel (Bet Builder Tab)

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Event Detail page with carousel enabled in the Bet Builder tab and precompiled cards available.
Steps.Expected Result: The carousel and its cards are displayed in the Bet Builder tab.

Steps.Step Description: Reload the Event Detail page without clearing the cache.
Steps.Expected Result: The carousel loads quickly, and the same precompiled cards are displayed from cache.

Steps.Step Description: Clear the application/browser cache and reload the Event Detail page.
Steps.Expected Result: The carousel fetches fresh precompiled cards from the server and displays them.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1. Precompiled cards are available for the event. 2. Application supports caching mechanism. 3. User has access to clear cache (browser or app).
test_cases.Dataset: Precompiled card data for event; cache enabled/disabled scenarios.
test_cases.Expected Result: Precompiled cards are cached and loaded quickly unless the cache is cleared, in which case fresh data is fetched.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers caching only for event detail carousel, not for Home Page.

test_cases.Title: Display of Randomly Generated Same Game Parlay (SGP) Precompiled Bets on Full Responsive Frontend (Italy)

Steps.Step Description: Access the Betting Full Responsive frontend (Italy version) via a supported browser on desktop.
Steps.Expected Result: The homepage loads successfully, displaying betting options.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to a sports event eligible for Same Game Parlay bets.
Steps.Expected Result: The event page loads, showing available betting markets.

Steps.Step Description: Locate the section for precompiled SGP bets generated by the SGP Generator.
Steps.Expected Result: A section labeled for precompiled SGP bets is visible on the event page.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the displayed SGP bets are generated randomly and differ upon page refresh or event change.
Steps.Expected Result: Each page refresh or event change results in a new set of randomly generated SGP bets.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has access to the Betting Full Responsive frontend (Italy version).
2. SGP Generator is operational and integrated.
3. At least one eligible sports event is available.
test_cases.Functionality: Same Game Parlay Precompiled Bets Display
test_cases.Dataset: N/A (uses live event data and SGP Generator output)
test_cases.Expected Result: Randomly generated SGP precompiled bets are displayed correctly on the event page for Italy, and change upon refresh or event change.

test_cases.Title: Error Handling: SGP Generator Unavailable

Steps.Step Description: Simulate SGP Generator service unavailability (e.g., by disconnecting the service or using a mock failure).

Steps.Step Description: Access the event page where SGP precompiled bets would normally be displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: The SGP precompiled bets section is either hidden or displays an appropriate error message (e.g., 'SGP bets currently unavailable').

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. SGP Generator service is intentionally made unavailable.
2. User has access to the Betting Full Responsive frontend.
test_cases.Functionality: Same Game Parlay Precompiled Bets Error Handling
test_cases.Dataset: N/A (service is unavailable)
test_cases.Expected Result: The frontend gracefully handles SGP Generator unavailability by hiding the SGP section or displaying an appropriate error message.

test_cases.Title: Verify Carosello Display and Title on Home Page (Full Responsive Online & Retail)

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Home Page on Full Responsive Online.
Steps.Expected Result: The Home Page loads successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the top section of the Home Page.
Steps.Expected Result: A carousel titled 'Bet Builder in evidenza / Bet Builder en vedette' is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Scroll below the carousel.
Steps.Expected Result: Two items labeled 'Calcio / Football' and 'Basket' are displayed below the carousel.

Steps.Step Description: Repeat steps 1-3 on Full Responsive Retail.
Steps.Expected Result: The same carousel and items are visible on Full Responsive Retail Home Page.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User is not logged in (anonymous session).
2. System is configured to display the carousel on both Full Responsive Online and Retail.
3. SGP cards are available from BE engine.
test_cases.Dataset: N/A
test_cases.Expected Result: The carousel with the correct title and the two items ('Calcio / Football' and 'Basket') are displayed on the Home Page for both Full Responsive Online and Retail.

test_cases.Title: Verify Carosello Content Changes Based on Selected Item (Calcio/Football or Basket)

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Home Page with the carousel visible.
Steps.Expected Result: Carousel and items 'Calcio / Football' and 'Basket' are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select the 'Calcio / Football' item below the carousel.
Steps.Expected Result: The carousel updates to display SGP cards dedicated to Calcio (Football) bets.

Steps.Step Description: Select the 'Basket' item below the carousel.
Steps.Expected Result: The carousel updates to display SGP cards dedicated to Basket bets.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Carousel is enabled and visible on the Home Page.
2. SGP cards for both Calcio and Basket are available from BE engine.
test_cases.Dataset: SGP cards for Calcio and Basket preloaded in BE engine.
test_cases.Expected Result: Selecting 'Calcio / Football' displays Calcio SGP cards; selecting 'Basket' displays Basket SGP cards in the carousel.

test_cases.Title: Verify Carousel Visibility Toggle on Full Responsive Retail (Hot Configuration)

Steps.Step Description: Access the configuration panel for Full Responsive Retail.
Steps.Expected Result: Configuration panel is accessible without system release.

Steps.Step Description: Set the carousel visibility to 'disabled' and save changes.
Steps.Expected Result: Configuration is saved successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Home Page on Full Responsive Retail.
Steps.Expected Result: The carousel is not displayed on the Home Page.

Steps.Step Description: Return to the configuration panel and set the carousel visibility to 'enabled'.
Steps.Expected Result: Configuration is saved successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Refresh the Home Page on Full Responsive Retail.
Steps.Expected Result: The carousel is now displayed on the Home Page.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has access to the configuration panel for Full Responsive Retail.
2. System supports hot configuration changes (no release required).
3. Carousel is initially enabled.
test_cases.Dataset: N/A
test_cases.Expected Result: Carousel visibility can be toggled on/off via configuration panel on Full Responsive Retail without requiring a release, and changes are reflected immediately on the Home Page.

test_cases.Title: Verify Carousel Not Displayed When Disabled via Configuration (Retail Only)

Steps.Expected Result: Carousel is set to 'disabled' in configuration.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Home Page on Full Responsive Retail.
Steps.Expected Result: The carousel is not displayed on the Home Page.

test_cases.Preconditions:

2. User is on the Home Page.
test_cases.Dataset: N/A
test_cases.Expected Result: When the carousel is disabled via configuration, it is not visible on the Full Responsive Retail Home Page.

test_cases.Title: Verify Carousel is Displayed on All Supported Devices (Responsiveness)

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Home Page on a desktop browser (Full Responsive Online).
Steps.Expected Result: Carousel is displayed correctly.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Home Page on a tablet device (Full Responsive Online).
Steps.Expected Result: Carousel is displayed correctly and adapts to tablet screen size.

test_cases.Title: Verify Error Handling When SGP Cards Are Not Available from BE Engine

Steps.Step Description: Simulate a scenario where the BE engine does not provide SGP cards for Calcio or Basket.
Steps.Expected Result: System recognizes that SGP cards are unavailable.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Home Page with the carousel enabled.
Steps.Expected Result: Carousel is displayed with a message indicating no SGP cards are available, or the carousel is hidden according to business rules.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Carousel is enabled in configuration.
2. BE engine is configured to return no SGP cards for both Calcio and Basket.
test_cases.Dataset: No SGP cards available from BE engine.
test_cases.Expected Result: If SGP cards are unavailable, the carousel displays an appropriate message or is hidden, as per business rules.

test_cases.Title: Carosello HP not displayed when no precompiled data is received from backend

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the backend is configured to return no precompiled data (neither Calcio nor Basket) for the Home Page request.
Steps.Expected Result: Backend returns an empty response for precompiled data.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Home Page of the application.
Steps.Expected Result: Home Page loads successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the presence of the Carosello HP component on the Home Page.
Steps.Expected Result: Carosello HP is not displayed on the Home Page.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User is not logged in (or as required by the application).
2. Backend is configured to return no precompiled data for both Calcio and Basket.
3. Application cache is cleared to avoid stale data.
test_cases.Dataset: No precompiled data for Calcio and Basket in backend response.
test_cases.Expected Result: Carosello HP is not visible when no precompiled data is received from backend.

test_cases.Title: Carosello HP displays only Calcio when Basket precompiled data is missing

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the backend is configured to return precompiled data only for Calcio and not for Basket.
Steps.Expected Result: Backend returns precompiled data for Calcio only.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Home Page of the application.
Steps.Expected Result: Home Page loads successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the items displayed in the Carosello HP component.

test_cases.Title: Verify precompiled cards are cached and persist for X minutes on homepage revisit

Steps.Step Description: Open the website and land on the homepage (HP) at time T0.
Steps.Expected Result: Homepage loads and precompiled cards are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Note the content and order of the precompiled cards displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: Content and order of precompiled cards are recorded for later comparison.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate away from the homepage to another section of the website.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully navigated to a different section; homepage is no longer visible.

Steps.Step Description: Wait for a period less than X minutes (e.g., X-1 minutes).
Steps.Expected Result: Elapsed time is less than the configured cache duration X.

Steps.Step Description: Return to the homepage within X minutes from the initial visit.
Steps.Expected Result: Homepage reloads.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the precompiled cards displayed on the homepage.
Steps.Expected Result: The same precompiled cards (content and order) as seen at T0 are displayed.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1. Cache duration X is configured as per business requirements. 2. Website is accessible. 3. User is not logged in (if applicable). 4. Browser cache is cleared before starting the test.
test_cases.Dataset: N/A (uses default homepage precompiled cards)
test_cases.Expected Result: Upon returning to the homepage within X minutes, the user sees the exact same precompiled cards as initially displayed at T0.

test_cases.Title: Verify precompiled cards are refreshed after cache expiration (X minutes)

Steps.Step Description: Open the website and land on the homepage (HP) at time T0.
Steps.Expected Result: Homepage loads and precompiled cards are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Note the content and order of the precompiled cards displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: Content and order of precompiled cards are recorded for later comparison.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate away from the homepage to another section of the website.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully navigated to a different section; homepage is no longer visible.

Steps.Step Description: Wait for a period greater than X minutes (e.g., X+1 minutes).
Steps.Expected Result: Elapsed time exceeds the configured cache duration X.

Steps.Step Description: Return to the homepage after X minutes have passed since the initial visit.
Steps.Expected Result: Homepage reloads.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the precompiled cards displayed on the homepage.
Steps.Expected Result: Precompiled cards are refreshed and may differ in content and/or order from those seen at T0.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1. Cache duration X is configured as per business requirements. 2. Website is accessible. 3. User is not logged in (if applicable). 4. Browser cache is cleared before starting the test.
test_cases.Dataset: N/A (uses default homepage precompiled cards)
test_cases.Expected Result: Upon returning to the homepage after X minutes, the precompiled cards are refreshed and may differ from those initially displayed at T0.

test_cases.Title: Verify cache duration X is only changeable via release and not runtime

Steps.Step Description: Access the system configuration for cache duration X.
Steps.Expected Result: Configuration interface or file for cache duration is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to change the value of X during runtime (without a release/deployment).
Steps.Expected Result: System does not allow changing cache duration X at runtime.

Steps.Step Description: Perform a system release/deployment with a new value for X.
Steps.Expected Result: System accepts the new value for X after release/deployment.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the new cache duration X is in effect after the release.
Steps.Expected Result: Cache duration for precompiled cards matches the newly configured value.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1. Access to system configuration and deployment tools. 2. Sufficient permissions to perform release/deployment. 3. Knowledge of current and new values for X.
test_cases.Dataset: Current and new values for X (e.g., X=5, X=10)
test_cases.Expected Result: Cache duration X can only be changed via a release/deployment, not at runtime.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers configuration management, not user-facing cache behavior.

test_cases.Title: Verify precompiled cards caching works for different browsers and devices

Steps.Step Description: Open the website homepage on Browser A (e.g., Chrome) at time T0.
Steps.Expected Result: Homepage loads and precompiled cards are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Note the content and order of the precompiled cards displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: Content and order of precompiled cards are recorded for later comparison.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate away from the homepage and return within X minutes.
Steps.Expected Result: Homepage reloads.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the same precompiled cards are displayed as at T0.
Steps.Expected Result: Precompiled cards match those seen at T0.

Steps.Step Description: Repeat steps 1-4 on Browser B (e.g., Firefox) and on a mobile device (e.g., iOS/Android).
Steps.Expected Result: Precompiled cards caching works consistently across browsers and devices.

test_cases.Reference System: Web - Windows 10/11, macOS, iOS, Android, Chrome/Edge/Firefox/Safari
test_cases.Preconditions: 1. Cache duration X is configured as per business requirements. 2. Website is accessible on all target browsers/devices. 3. Browser cache is cleared before starting the test on each device.
test_cases.Dataset: N/A (uses default homepage precompiled cards)
test_cases.Expected Result: Precompiled cards caching works consistently across supported browsers and devices within the configured cache duration X.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers cross-browser and cross-device compatibility.

test_cases.Title: Verify that cache is user/session-specific and not shared across users

Steps.Step Description: User A opens the website homepage at time T0 and notes the precompiled cards displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: User A sees a set of precompiled cards and records their content/order.

Steps.Step Description: User B opens the website homepage at time T0 on a different device or browser.
Steps.Expected Result: User B sees a set of precompiled cards (may differ from User A's cards) and records their content/order.

Steps.Step Description: User A navigates away from and returns to the homepage within X minutes.
Steps.Expected Result: User A sees the same precompiled cards as initially displayed.

Steps.Step Description: User B navigates away from and returns to the homepage within X minutes.
Steps.Expected Result: User B sees the same precompiled cards as initially displayed to User B.

Steps.Step Description: Compare the precompiled cards seen by User A and User B.
Steps.Expected Result: Cache is user/session-specific; User A and User B do not see each other's cached cards.

test_cases.Reference System: Web - Windows 10/11, macOS, iOS, Android, Chrome/Edge/Firefox/Safari
test_cases.Preconditions: 1. Cache duration X is configured as per business requirements. 2. Two separate user sessions (different browsers/devices or incognito mode). 3. Website is accessible.
test_cases.Dataset: N/A (uses default homepage precompiled cards)
test_cases.Expected Result: Cache of precompiled cards is user/session-specific and not shared across users.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers session/user isolation for cache.

test_cases.Title: Display Only Non-Expired Events in Carousel Cards

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the application and navigate to the Home Page (HP).
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully logged in and the HP is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the carousel displays event cards fetched from the backend engine (SGP).
Steps.Expected Result: Carousel displays event cards as provided by the backend.

Steps.Step Description: Check the start date and time of each event displayed in the carousel.
Steps.Expected Result: All displayed events have a start date and time that is in the future (i.e., not yet passed).

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User has a valid account and is logged in.
2. Backend engine (SGP) provides a mix of events, some with start date/time in the past and some in the future.
3. Cache is valid (not expired, within X minutes).
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials; Event data with mixed start times (past and future).
test_cases.Expected Result: Only event cards with a start date and time in the future are displayed in the carousel. Expired events are not shown.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Does not cover cache expiration or backend refresh scenarios.

test_cases.Title: Expired Events Are Removed from Carousel Upon Return to Home Page Within Cache Validity

Steps.Step Description: Log in and navigate to the Home Page (HP).
Steps.Expected Result: User is on the HP and carousel displays event cards.

Steps.Step Description: Note the list of events displayed in the carousel, including their start date and time.
Steps.Expected Result: List of events with their start times is recorded.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate away from the HP (e.g., to another section of the app).
Steps.Expected Result: User leaves the HP.

Steps.Step Description: Wait until the start date and time of one or more displayed events has passed, but remain within the cache validity period (X minutes).
Steps.Expected Result: Some events have now expired, but cache is still valid.

Steps.Step Description: Return to the HP.
Steps.Expected Result: Carousel updates to remove expired events; only non-expired events are displayed.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User is logged in.
2. Carousel initially displays events with start times both before and after the current time.
3. Cache is valid (within X minutes).
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials; Event data with start times close to current time.
test_cases.Expected Result: Upon returning to HP, only non-expired events are shown in the carousel. Expired events are no longer visible.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Does not cover scenario where all events expire.

test_cases.Title: Frontend Requests New Events When All Cached Events Are Expired

Steps.Step Description: Log in and navigate to the Home Page (HP).
Steps.Expected Result: User is on the HP and carousel displays event cards.

Steps.Step Description: Note the list of events displayed in the carousel, all with start date and time close to the current time.
Steps.Expected Result: All events are about to expire.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate away from the HP (e.g., to another section of the app).
Steps.Expected Result: User leaves the HP.

Steps.Step Description: Wait until all events' start date and time have passed, but remain within the cache validity period (X minutes).
Steps.Expected Result: All events are now expired, but cache is still valid.

Steps.Step Description: Return to the HP.
Steps.Expected Result: Frontend detects all events are expired, triggers a new backend call, and displays new event cards. Cache timer is reset.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User is logged in.
2. Carousel initially displays only events with start times about to expire.
3. Cache is valid (within X minutes).
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials; Event data with start times about to expire.
test_cases.Expected Result: If all cached events are expired upon return to HP, the frontend requests new events from the backend and displays them. Cache timer is reset.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only the scenario where all events expire within cache validity.

test_cases.Title: No Backend Call When At Least One Event Is Still Valid in Cache

Steps.Step Description: Log in and navigate to the Home Page (HP).
Steps.Expected Result: User is on the HP and carousel displays event cards.

Steps.Step Description: Note the list of events displayed, ensuring at least one event has a start date/time in the future and others are about to expire.
Steps.Expected Result: At least one event is still valid.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate away from the HP.
Steps.Expected Result: User leaves the HP.

Steps.Step Description: Wait until all but one event have expired, but remain within the cache validity period (X minutes).
Steps.Expected Result: Only one event remains valid.

Steps.Step Description: Return to the HP.
Steps.Expected Result: Frontend does not make a new backend call; carousel displays only the remaining valid event(s).

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User is logged in.
2. Carousel displays multiple events, at least one with a start time in the future.
3. Cache is valid (within X minutes).
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials; Event data with staggered start times.
test_cases.Expected Result: If at least one event is still valid, the frontend does not request new events from the backend and displays only the valid event(s).
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Does not cover cache expiration or all events expired scenarios.

test_cases.Title: Expired Events Are Not Displayed After Cache Expiry and New Backend Call

Steps.Step Description: Log in and navigate to the Home Page (HP).
Steps.Expected Result: User is on the HP and carousel displays event cards.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate away from the HP.
Steps.Expected Result: User leaves the HP.

Steps.Step Description: Wait until the cache expires (after X minutes).
Steps.Expected Result: Cache is now invalid.

Steps.Step Description: Return to the HP.
Steps.Expected Result: Frontend makes a new backend call and displays only non-expired events in the carousel.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User is logged in.
2. Carousel displays events with start times in the near future.
3. Cache is valid at first, then expires during the test.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials; Event data with start times in the near future.
test_cases.Expected Result: After cache expiry and backend refresh, only non-expired events are displayed in the carousel.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Focuses on cache expiration and backend refresh.

test_cases.Title: Verify cache is user-specific: precompiled cards are not shared across different users

Steps.Step Description: User 1 logs in and accesses the event detail page for a specific event (T0).
Steps.Expected Result: Event detail page loads and displays precompiled cards for User 1.

Steps.Step Description: User 1 notes the content of the precompiled cards.
Steps.Expected Result: User 1's precompiled cards are visible and content is recorded.

Steps.Step Description: User 2 logs in (on a different browser or incognito window) and accesses the same event detail page.
Steps.Expected Result: Event detail page loads and displays precompiled cards for User 2.

Steps.Step Description: User 2 notes the content of the precompiled cards.
Steps.Expected Result: User 2's precompiled cards are visible and content is recorded.

Steps.Step Description: Compare the precompiled cards displayed to User 1 and User 2.
Steps.Expected Result: Precompiled cards are not shared between users; each user sees their own cards (if cards are user-specific).

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. Two valid user accounts are available.
2. Event with precompiled cards is available.
3. Cache duration X is known and configured in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: User 1 credentials, User 2 credentials, Event ID, Cache duration X (e.g., 10 minutes)
test_cases.Expected Result: Precompiled cards are cached per user and not shared across different users.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Assumes precompiled cards are user-specific; if not, this test may be skipped.
test_cases._polarion: Memorizzazione in cache delle precompilate su avvenimento

test_cases.Title: Verify cache is cleared when browser cache is cleared

Steps.Step Description: Access the event detail page for a specific event (T0).
Steps.Expected Result: Event detail page loads and displays precompiled cards.

Steps.Step Description: Note the content of the precompiled cards.
Steps.Expected Result: Precompiled cards are visible and content is recorded.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate away from the event detail page.
Steps.Expected Result: User is redirected to another section.

Steps.Step Description: Clear the browser cache (all site data).
Steps.Expected Result: Browser cache is cleared.

Steps.Step Description: Return to the same event detail page within X minutes from T0.
Steps.Expected Result: Event detail page reloads.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the precompiled cards displayed upon return.
Steps.Expected Result: Precompiled cards are refreshed (not loaded from previous cache); may differ from those seen at T0 if data has changed.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. User is authenticated (if required).
2. Event with precompiled cards is available.
3. Cache duration X is known and configured in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: Event ID, User credentials (if login required), Cache duration X (e.g., 10 minutes)
test_cases.Expected Result: After clearing browser cache, precompiled cards are not loaded from previous cache and may be refreshed.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers browser cache interaction; may not apply if caching is server-side only.
test_cases._polarion: Memorizzazione in cache delle precompilate su avvenimento

test_cases.Title: Verify DWH Tracking for Plays from Precompiled SGP Cards

Steps.Step Description: Access the system and ensure the DWH tracking module is active.
Steps.Expected Result: DWH tracking module is available and operational.

Steps.Step Description: Initiate a play using a precompiled SGP Card as per the DWH_SGP Generator specification.
Steps.Expected Result: The play is successfully processed by the system.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the play event is logged in the DWH according to the format and fields specified in the DWH_SGP Generator document.
Steps.Expected Result: A corresponding entry for the play is present in the DWH with all required fields populated as per specification.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. DWH tracking module deployed and configured.
2. Precompiled SGP Card available for testing.
3. Access to DWH database for verification.
4. Tester has necessary permissions to execute plays and query DWH.
test_cases.Dataset: Precompiled SGP Card data as per DWH_SGP Generator (SN: PRJ0011767) specification.
test_cases.Expected Result: Plays from precompiled SGP Cards are correctly tracked and stored in the DWH as per the DWH_SGP Generator specification.

test_cases.Title: Verify Error Handling for Invalid Precompiled SGP Card in DWH Tracking

Steps.Step Description: Access the system and ensure the DWH tracking module is active.
Steps.Expected Result: DWH tracking module is available and operational.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to initiate a play using an invalid or corrupted precompiled SGP Card.
Steps.Expected Result: The system rejects the play and logs an error event.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that no invalid play entry is created in the DWH, but an error log is present as per DWH_SGP Generator specification.
Steps.Expected Result: No play entry is created in the DWH for the invalid card; an error log is present as specified.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. DWH tracking module deployed and configured.
2. Invalid or corrupted precompiled SGP Card available for testing.
3. Access to DWH database and error logs for verification.
4. Tester has necessary permissions to execute plays and query DWH.
test_cases.Dataset: Invalid or corrupted precompiled SGP Card data as per DWH_SGP Generator (SN: PRJ0011767) specification.
test_cases.Expected Result: Invalid plays from precompiled SGP Cards are not tracked in the DWH, and appropriate error logs are generated as per specification.

test_cases.Title: Verify DWH Tracking for Boundary Values in Precompiled SGP Card Plays

Steps.Step Description: Access the system and ensure the DWH tracking module is active.
Steps.Expected Result: DWH tracking module is available and operational.

Steps.Step Description: Initiate plays using precompiled SGP Cards with boundary values (e.g., minimum and maximum allowed bet amounts, edge-case card data) as per DWH_SGP Generator specification.
Steps.Expected Result: The plays are successfully processed by the system.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that each play event is logged in the DWH with correct boundary values as per the DWH_SGP Generator document.
Steps.Expected Result: Corresponding entries for each play are present in the DWH with boundary values correctly recorded as per specification.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1. DWH tracking module deployed and configured.
2. Precompiled SGP Cards with boundary values available for testing.
3. Access to DWH database for verification.
4. Tester has necessary permissions to execute plays and query DWH.
test_cases.Dataset: Precompiled SGP Card data with boundary values as per DWH_SGP Generator (SN: PRJ0011767) specification.
test_cases.Expected Result: Plays from precompiled SGP Cards with boundary values are correctly tracked and stored in the DWH as per the DWH_SGP Generator specification.
